reasons_to_visit.details: Fringe, International Festival, Tattoo, Book Festival-Edinburgh becomes the world's stage.
Nightly displays illuminate the castle sky.

reasons_to_reconsider.details: Accommodation often sold out; streets extremely busy.
Expect premium rates for everything from lodging to taxis.

weather.general_tips: Carry reusable water bottle, sunscreen, and rain jacket.

tourism_level.overall_atmosphere: Festival frenzy with performers on every corner.

events_holidays.name: Fringe Opening
events_holidays.notes: Use half-price huts for same-day ticket deals.

unique_experiences.description: Massed pipes, projection mapping, and fireworks.
unique_experiences.practical_tips: Bring waterproof layers; theatre seats are exposed.

unique_experiences.description: Midnight shows keep the party going.
unique_experiences.practical_tips: Book ahead; venues get hot-dress light.

weather.general_tips: Plan rest days-festival fatigue is real.

tourism_level.overall_atmosphere: Energetic yet hectic; late-season deals appear last week.

events_holidays.name: Festival Fireworks Concert
events_holidays.description: International Festival finale with live orchestra and pyrotechnics.
events_holidays.notes: Stake out viewing spots on Inverleith Park hours early.

unique_experiences.description: Meet authors and attend signings in leafy tents.
unique_experiences.practical_tips: Many events free, but tickets required for headline authors.

unique_experiences.description: Experimental shows in former veterinary school.
unique_experiences.practical_tips: Arrive early to navigate maze of venues.
